result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt: 8:30 AM Defendant David G Diayen in court, in custody.  Attorney Allegra L Berry in court for David G Diayen.  Prosecuting attorney Hector Al-Homsi in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defn feels like he is competent. State in agreement w/ Dr report. Dr. C. J., appeared by phone, duly sworn and testified. Direct exam by State. Dr report marked as exhibit 1. Cross exam by Defn. Direct exam by CT. Recross exam by Defn. Closing argument by State. Closing argument by Defn. CT finds that Defn is not competent, but likely regain competency. CT suspends proceedings and signs order to treat.

The original document was titled: Defendant's Affidavit in Support of Competency Evaluation

Pre-trial conference on August 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Zoom

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not threaten or direct any acts of physical violence towards JDD or any other person in their residence. 
- Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon [as defined by Wis. Stat. 939.22(10)]. 
Trial Judge - Br 12 

Defendant has acknowledged and agreed to terms and conditions of bond. Defendant must return signed bond form within 10 days of today. Any bail money previously posted will not be returned until a signed bond form is on file with the Clerk of Courts.

02:05 PM Defendant in court, in custody via Zoom from the UW Hospital with Attorney Jacob A Idlas.  Thersa Louise Lewandowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts. Brief adjournment. 02:19 PM Case re-called.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
